title: LSU fires Kelly, still finalizing his $54M buyout
content: A day after a 49-25 loss to Texas A&M in Baton Rouge, LSU fired coach Brian Kelly on Sunday night, with athletic director Scott Woodward announcing in a statement that "we had high hopes that he would lead us to multiple SEC and national championships."

title: Love outduels Rodgers as Pack tout 'the successor'
content: With former Green Bay quarterback Aaron Rodgers watching from the sidelines, Jordan Love showed just how much he learned from his predecessor en route to the Packers' impressive 35-25 victory over the Steelers on Sunday night in Pittsburgh.

title: Orioles tab Albernaz as next manager, sources say
content: The Baltimore Orioles are finalizing a deal to hire former Guardians associate manager Craig Albernaz, sources told ESPN on Sunday.

title: Flagg ignites Mavericks' offense in first NBA win
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg became the fifth-youngest player in NBA history to score at least 20 points in his first NBA win Sunday.

title: Reaves nets career-high 51 for Luka-less Lakers
content: Austin Reaves scored a career-high 51 points in leading the short-handed Lakers past the Kings on Sunday night without Luka Doncic.

title: After emotional week, Fields helps Jets stun Cincy
content: Justin Fields helped the Jets stage one of the biggest comebacks in franchise history, stunning the Bengals on Sunday.

title: Giants 'devastated' after Skattebo dislocates ankle
content: Giants rookie running back Cam Skattebo was carted off the field Sunday because of a gruesome right ankle injury.

title: Jerry skeptical Dallas is '1 player away on defense'
content: Following the Cowboys' blowout loss to the Broncos on Sunday, owner and GM Jerry Jones indicated he is willing to engage on a trade but isn't convinced the team's defense is "one player away" from being competitive.

title: What you need to know from Week 8: Jordan Love, Packers defeat Rodgers
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 8.

title: Justin Fields won't get benched? Myles Garrett is DPOY? Let's overreact to Week 8
content: We sized up Week 8 overreactions, including fantasy. Is Fields on more solid ground? Will Garrett be the DPOY?

title: Week 8 winners and losers: Taylor and Cook deliver; CMC and Robinson fall flat
content: Jonathan Taylor, James Cook III and Saquon Barkley led the way with big Week 8 performances, while Christian McCaffrey, Bijan Robinson and Caleb Williams were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Giants lose Skattebo, Bigsby steps up for Eagles
content: Cam Skattebo's ankle injury and Tank Bigsby stepping up for Philadelphia are among the top fantasy storylines.

title: The 4 teams currently playing like national champions -- and why
content: After nine weeks of twists and turns, these teams are at the head of the class -- at least for the time being.

title: World Series and MNF, plus NBA, NHL and more showdowns
content: Celebrate the sports equinox with the World Series, 'Monday Night Football,' NBA and NHL headliners, plus MLS playoffs and more.

title: Alonso turns Clásico tide in Madrid's favor with statement win over Barça
content: Real Madrid lost to Barcelona four times last season. Xabi Alonso proved why he's the man for Los Blancos' job.

title: How Norris rediscovered F1 title 'favorite' tag in Mexico
content: Lando Norris hasn't been F1's title favorite for some time, but his Mexico win puts him atop the standings.

title: Moultrie & Co. get Hayes' team back playing 'the USA way'
content: For a team that prides itself on playing "the USA way," Sunday's 3-1 win over Portugal was a good response to Thursday's shock loss.

title: Eze gives Arsenal a 'magic moment' to sink old club Palace
content: Arsenal's defense are formidable but the signing of Eberechi Eze up front has made a real difference in tight games.

title: VAR review: Should Man United have had a penalty vs. Brighton?
content: Amad Diallo ran into the Brighton area, drawing Maxim De Cuyper into making a challenge. But was it a penalty?

title: Byron, Larson get last spots in NASCAR title finale
content: William Byron won at Martinsville Speedway in the third-round finale of the NASCAR Cup Series playoffs, while Kyle Larson sealed the final Championship 4 spot on points.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What to make of big games from Ty Simpson, Anthony Hill Jr.
content: Could Ty Simpson be the QB1? Is Anthony Hill Jr. climbing the LB ranks again? We have notes on NFL prospects through CFB Week 9.

title: Takeaways from Dodgers' series-tying win over Blue Jays
content: After Toronto rolled in the opener, Los Angeles rebounded to even the Fall Classic. Here's how it went down.

title: What's next: Rebook Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane immediately
content: UFC 321 ended in disaster, but it is pretty clear what the next step is for the heavyweight division.

title: Red-hot Michael Brennan wins in Utah for first tour title
content: Michael Brennan was just as dominant at Black Desert as he was on the PGA Tour Americas. He closed with a 5-under 66 to go from a sponsor exemption to a PGA Tour winner Sunday with his four-shot victory in the Bank of Utah Championship.

title: X-ray tables, marked cards and the Mafia: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: Details of how poker games, some involving Chauncey Billups, were allegedly rigged to make people lose big.

title: WWE 'SmackDown' highlights: McIntyre heats up title match against Rhodes
content: Friday's "SmackDown" set up a perfect "Saturday Night's Main Event," with Drew McIntyre and Cody Rhodes ready for the challenge.

title: Week 8 recap: Ravens win and cover after Lamar Jackson injury report debacle
content: The Ravens -- as well as the AFC East -- had a big day for bettors during Week 8 of the NFL season, but not without some controversy.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Son to consider Milan loan in MLS offseason
content: Barcelona scouts are keeping tabs on Marseille striker Mason Greenwood. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Shreyas Iyer still in ICU after dangerously low body vitals, internal bleeding
content: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is currently in the ICU of a Sydney hospital following a serious fall during the third ODI against Australia. Reports indicate he experienced dangerously low body vitals post-incident and was immediately hospitalized in a critical, life-threatening condition. His recovery is ongoing.

title: Can evade any defence system: Russia now has nuclear-powered missile; what is Burevestnik?
content: Russia successfully tested its nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, a weapon President Putin claims can "pierce any defence shield." The test, conducted alongside a nuclear drill, signals Moscow's defiance against Western pressure over Ukraine. Putin announced the country will now move towards deploying the "invincible" missile, which reportedly traveled 14,000 kilometers.

title: ‘Problem is volume’: SC seeks report on digital arrests; directs CBI to draft probe plan
content: The Supreme Court has issued notices to all states and Union Territories regarding the escalating digital arrest scams, seeking details on registered FIRs and ongoing investigations. The court is considering entrusting the overall probe to the CBI for better coordination, especially for transnational crimes, and will hear the matter again on November 3.

title: Tragic! Indian Jujitsu player found dead; family alleges workplace harassment
content: International Jujitsu player Rohini Kalam, 35, was found dead at her Dewas residence, with preliminary findings suggesting suicide. Her sister reported work-related stress and alleged harassment from her school principal. Rohini, who had aspirations of becoming an IPS officer and had recently undergone surgery, was a decorated athlete with multiple international accolades.

title: Sold land, crossed jungles: Over 50 Indians handcuffed, deported from US; agent vanishes with crores
content: Recently, more than 50 individuals, most between the ages of 25 and 30, found themselves back in Haryana after being deported from the US while trying to enter through the 'dunki' route. One deportee expressed frustration over losing Rs 57 lakh to a deceitful agent, facing intimidation and possible jail sentences as a result.

title: Amazon founder says future is bright; millions could live off Earth by 2045
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos expressed optimism about humanity's future, predicting "civilizational abundance" driven by AI and space exploration. He envisions millions living in space by 2045, chosen by preference, with robots handling labor. Bezos believes technological inventions, like the plow historically, consistently increase prosperity for all.

title: JNU Polls 2025-26: Candidates file nominations today; when will the final list release?
content: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has entered the key phase of its 2025-26 student union elections, with candidates filing nominations on October 27. The final list of contestants will be released on October 28, followed by campaigning, debates, and polling on November 4. Results are expected on November 6, reflecting the campus’s dynamic political landscape.

title: Flying into US? Your photo will be sent into facial recognition database
content: US Customs and Border Protection will expand its biometric tracking, photographing nearly all non-US citizens entering or departing the country. This new rule, effective soon, aims to enhance national security and combat fraudulent travel by creating a comprehensive facial-recognition database.  It eliminates previous age exemptions and applies to all non-citizens, including lawful permanent residents.

title: 'Image of country ... ': SC slams states, UTs on stray dog case; chief secretaries told to appear
content: The Supreme Court has summoned Chief Secretaries of all states and Union Territories, except Delhi, West Bengal, and Telangana, to appear on November 3. This action follows their failure to comply with court directives on managing the stray dog menace and submitting compliance reports.

title: Lesson from Google, Amazon: Nvidia, AMD copy employee playbook; perks to retain staff
content: Leading chipmakers Nvidia, AMD, and Broadcom are adopting big tech's strategy of offering substantial, multi-year stock-based compensation packages to retain employees. These "golden handcuffs" are proving effective, with employee retention rates soaring amid the AI boom and significant growth in equity valuations.

title: Bank holiday on Chhath Puja: Will banks remain closed today? Check state-wise list
content: Banks in Bihar, Jharkhand, and West Bengal are closed today for Chhath Puja, with some regions extending the holiday to tomorrow. These closures are state-specific, while other parts of India will have normal banking operations. Customers can utilize digital banking services for transactions during this period.

title: Real contest is NDA vs Jan Suraaj? Prashant Kishor claims 'Mahagathbandhan' at third spot
content: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj party claims the Bihar electoral battle will be a direct contest between the NDA and his outfit, pushing the Mahagathbandhan to a distant third. Kishor criticized Tejashwi Yadav's recent announcements as irrelevant attempts to gain attention.  Bihar will vote on November 6 and 11.

title: Refusing marital intimacy amounts to mental cruelty, says HC – Ruling explained
content: The Delhi High Court upheld a divorce decree for a husband, citing mental cruelty. The wife's prolonged refusal of intimacy, repeated absences, retaliatory criminal complaints, and alienation of their son were deemed to make continuing the marriage impossible. These actions collectively constituted mental cruelty under the Hindu Marriage Act.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Lil Zay Osama faces backlash for threatening streamers live on stream
content: Rapper Lil Zay Osama is embroiled in controversy after a livestream dispute with streamers Summyah and Aspen Kartier escalated to threats. The altercation, reportedly stemming from Osama mentioning Summyah's ex, led to a physical confrontation and viral outrage. Osama's aggressive response has drawn widespread criticism, leaving fans questioning his career's future amidst ongoing public drama.

title: Next CJI: BR Gavai recommends Justice Surya Kant as successor; Centre to notify
content: Chief Justice of India B R Gavai has recommended Justice Surya Kant as his successor. Justice Kant, the senior-most judge after CJI Gavai, is set to become the 53rd Chief Justice of India on November 23 and will serve until February 2027. He hails from Haryana and has a distinguished legal career.

title: ‘A leader of men' - Rohit’s redemption story wins hearts; receives award - watch
content: India's strength and conditioning coach Adrian Le Roux lauded Rohit Sharma as the 'Impact Player of the Series' for his stellar batting against Australia. Sharma's unbeaten 121 secured India's lone win, avoiding a whitewash. He credited his preparation and a crucial partnership with Virat Kohli for his success.

title: Cyclone Montha brewing: Red alert in Andhra, Odisha, landfall likely near Kakinada
content: Cyclone Montha is set to make landfall in Andhra Pradesh on October 28 evening, intensifying into a severe cyclonic storm with winds up to 110 kmph. Coastal Andhra and south Odisha are bracing for heavy rainfall and strong winds. Authorities have placed the state on high alert, initiating evacuations and pre-positioning relief materials.

title: Reset in US-Brazil ties? Lula says Trump 'assured' him of trade deal
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva announced that US President Trump assured him a trade deal is imminent, signaling a potential thaw in strained relations. Following a meeting at the ASEAN summit, both leaders agreed to immediate discussions to resolve tariff and sanctions disputes. Trump also announced several regional trade initiatives and a peace accord between Cambodia and Thailand.

title: 'Racially aggravated attack': 20-yr-old Indian-origin woman raped in UK
content: Walsall police are hunting a white male suspect after a racially aggravated rape of a young woman of Indian heritage. The victim was found distressed on Saturday evening. Authorities have released CCTV footage and are appealing for witnesses. The incident has caused concern in the diverse community, with increased police presence planned.

title: Are Jay Bhanushali and Mahhi Vij heading for a divorce after 14 years of marriage?
content: Actors Jay Bhanushali and Mahhi Vij are reportedly heading for divorce, having allegedly filed papers a few months ago and finalized them in July-August. A source close to the couple confirmed the separation, noting a long period of distance and a decision on child custody. Previously, Vij had addressed divorce rumors, questioning public scrutiny.

title: Rohit shocked! Magician reads his mind and reveals ... - Watch
content: Indian cricket star Rohit Sharma was amazed when magician Naman Anand correctly guessed the name he was thinking of. The incident happened at a friends' gathering after Rohit's century in Sydney.  The successful mind-reading trick has become a talking point online.  Fans shared humorous comments about the demonstration.  This lighthearted moment showcased a different side of the cricketer's life.

title: Lyricist Snehan's father passes away; final rites to be held in Thanjavur
content: In a heartbreaking turn of events, esteemed Tamil lyricist Snehan is grieving the untimely passing of his father earlier today, October 27. The news has resonated deeply, eliciting heartfelt condolences from fans and fellow artists alike. Final rites will be held tomorrow, October 28, in Thanjavur.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for this week?
content: Gold prices are expected to trade lower in the coming days, according to Manav Modi of Motilal Oswal. Last week saw a sharp fall in gold and silver after significant gains, influenced by hopes of ceasefires and easing US-China tensions.

title: 'Maha knows Deva bhau’: Fadnavis says ex-MP needlessly dragged in doctor suicide case
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis asserted that former MP Ranjeetsingh Naik Nimbalkar and MLA Sachin Patil were wrongly implicated in a doctor's suicide case. He pledged justice for the deceased, emphasizing that political motives were behind attempts to tarnish reputations. The investigation is focusing on the doctor's palm note detailing harassment.

title: 600 cops, 24x7 patrols: World cup on high alert after molestation of Aus women cricketers
content: Navi Mumbai has bolstered security for the Women's World Cup 2025 semifinals and final following a molestation incident involving Australian players in Indore. Approximately 600 personnel, including officers and constables, are deployed, with 24-hour hotel security and dedicated escorts for all team movements. Players are urged to inform authorities before leaving their hotels to ensure their protection.

title: Netanyahu says Israel needs 'no approval' to strike Gaza
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asserted Israel's sovereignty in national security decisions, emphasizing self-defense and independent action. He stated Israel will determine acceptable international forces for a Gaza security force, rejecting a role for Turkey. These remarks followed discussions in Washington regarding the Gaza Strip's future and a fragile ceasefire.

title: Bloodbath over 6 bigha: Man crushed by SUV, family assaulted, clothes torn
content: A land dispute turned deadly in Guna district, Madhya Pradesh, where a group of 15 people attacked a family. Ramswaroop Nagar was killed and four others injured, including his wife and two teenage girls, who were also reportedly assaulted. Authorities are searching for the accused.

title: Andhra bus fire: Bike was dragged for 200m by vehicle
content: Andhra Pradesh police confirmed Shiva Shankar, the biker whose vehicle ignited the Kurnool bus fire that killed 19, was intoxicated. FSL tests revealed alcohol in Shankar's viscera, indicating he was drunk when his bike crashed into a divider and was subsequently dragged by the bus, causing the fatal blaze. Shankar died instantly from the collision.

title: Praise or taunt? Elon Musk calls Zohran Mamdani 'future of Democratic Party' - watch
content: Elon Musk called Zohran Mamdano 'the future of Democratic Party' igniting debate about the Democratic Party's future. Governor Kathy Hochul's endorsement of Zohran Mamdani, a democratic socialist, drew criticism. Musk's remarks framed this as a leftward shift. Voters expressed concerns about Mamdani's agenda, with some calling it 'far-left' and others linking it to 'communism'.

title: Amit Shah to inaugurate India Maritime Week 2025 in Mumbai — all you need to know
content: India Maritime Week 2025, commencing October 27 in Mumbai, will unite global maritime leaders under the theme “Uniting Oceans, One Maritime Vision.” Organized by MoPSW, the event aims to showcase India's growing role as a maritime hub and Blue Economy leader, fostering international collaboration and investment across various sectors.

title: 'Do bhai, dono tabahi': Virat Kohli–Rohit Sharma promo takes internet by storm - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are set to feature in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, commencing November 30. Their stellar partnership in the third ODI against Australia, where Rohit scored a century and Kohli a fluent half-century, powered India to a commanding win. The duo expressed their fondness for playing in Australia and their enduring bond.

title: Anthony Edwards leaves Timberwolves home opener vs Pacers with injury
content: Minnesota Timberwolves' home opener took a concerning turn as star guard Anthony Edwards exited early with right hamstring tightness. He left the game just over three minutes in after finishing a layup, with the team confirming he would not return. This setback impacts the Timberwolves' early season momentum and depth.

title: 'Kept screaming, no one stopped to help': DU student attacked with acid; suspects on the run
content: A 19-year-old Delhi University student was attacked with acid by a known stalker and his two associates in Ashok Vihar. The victim sustained burn injuries on her hands and arms while trying to shield her face. She had previously confronted the married stalker, who allegedly threatened her.

title: Sydney ODI | Gambhir's stern message to Harshit Rana - 'Stay grounded'
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Harshit Rana's stellar performance in the third ODI, urging him to remain humble and grounded.  Gambhir's 'tough love' approach, including a stern warning to perform or face exclusion, reportedly motivated the young pacer.  Rana's childhood coach defended the player and Gambhir's talent identification, emphasizing Rana's potential.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations:Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified Laurus Labs and 360 ONE WAM as top stock picks for Diwali week. Laurus Labs' strong quarterly performance and expansion plans, coupled with 360 ONE WAM's robust growth in assets under management and profitability, position them for significant upside.

title: What happens to your body after a stroke: Know health risks and side effects
content: A stroke occurs when blood flow to the brain is interrupted, causing brain cells to shut down. This can lead to a wide range of effects impacting the respiratory, nervous, circulatory, muscular, digestive, urinary, and reproductive systems. Understanding these effects is crucial for recognizing warning signs and facilitating a smoother recovery.

title: 'Lesson for them': MP minister's shocking remark on Australian cricketers’ molestation
content: MP minister Kailash Vijayvargiya advised international cricketers to inform local authorities before leaving their accommodations due to immense fan craze in India. This statement follows an alleged molestation incident involving two Australian women cricketers in Indore, highlighting the need for enhanced communication and security protocols.

title: Karun Nair breaks silence; slams Ajit Agarkar - 'I deserved more'
content: Despite recent national team snubs, Karun Nair is determined to keep scoring runs, aiming to win games for his current team.  He expressed disappointment at being overlooked after strong domestic performances, believing he deserves more opportunities. Nair remains focused on his game, with playing for India his ultimate goal.

title: After dispute with wife, man slits twin daughters throats; dumps bodies in forest
content: A man, after a dispute with his wife, murdered his two twin daughters by slitting their throats on Diwali. He then dumped their bodies in a forest in Buldhana district. The father confessed to the crime four days later at a police station in Washim district.

title: Andhra bus tragedy: Vemuri Kaveri Travels owner added as 2nd accused; biker was drunk
content: A drunk biker, Shiva Shankar, whose vehicle was dragged by a bus, triggered a fire that killed 19 passengers in Kurnool. Shankar died after hitting a divider, but his bike lay on the road, leading to the tragedy. Police have booked Shankar for rash driving and negligent behavior.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,850; BSE Sensex up over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday on positive global cues. While Nifty50 was above 25,850, BSE Sensex was up over 200 points.

title: Delhi horror: Woman kills boyfriend with help from ex, stages it as 'fire'
content: A live-in relationship turned deadly as a 21-year-old woman, her ex-boyfriend, and his friend allegedly murdered her partner, a UPSC aspirant, in Delhi. They staged the crime as a fire incident to conceal the murder, driven by the victim's alleged possession of objectionable content. The trio has been arrested.

title: UP student attacked: Stomach slit, 2 fingers chopped off; kin tie intestines with cloth
content: In a shocking incident in Kanpur, a law student fell victim to a vicious assault by a pharmacy owner and three accomplices over a disagreement on pricing. The horrific attack left him with life-threatening injuries, such as a split abdomen and severed fingers. The victim's family claims that authorities initially misrepresented the case against him.

title: Who is Sami Hamdi? Muslim journalist detained by ICE at San Francisco Airport
content: British Muslim journalist Sami Hamdi was detained by ICE at San Francisco International Airport after his visa was revoked. Officials stated those supporting terrorism and undermining national security are barred from the US. Hamdi, editor of The International Interest, was reportedly detained due to his criticism of the Israeli government.

title: ‘Conducting routine ops’: US Navy helicopter, fighter jet go down in South China Sea; key details
content: Two US Navy aircraft, a helicopter and a fighter jet, crashed separately in the South China Sea during routine operations from the USS Nimitz. All five crew members were safely rescued. The incidents occurred while President Trump was visiting the region, amidst ongoing trade tensions with China. The Navy is investigating the causes.

title: Uproar in J&K Assembly over AAP MLA's detention under PSA
content: NC MLA from Banihal, Sajjad Shaheen, demanded a one-hour discussion on the Doda MLA's detention last month under the stringent act

title: Rajeev Chandrasekhar accuses Kerala govt of propaganda over claims of eradicating extreme poverty
content: BJP Kerala president says reduction in poverty in State is ‘due to schemes sponsored by Union government’

title: Supreme Court allows Centre to examine Vodafone Idea’s plea against DoT’s AGR demands
content: A Bench comprising Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justice K. Vinod Chandran passed the order while hearing a writ petition filed by Vodafone Idea challenging fresh AGR-related demands raised by the DoT

title: All MLAs must unite for daily wage workers’ regularisation in J&K: Mehbooba Mufti
content: The former Chief Minister of the erstwhile state said the workers, often from the most marginalised sections of society, have been the backbone of many government departments, ensuring their smooth functioning

title: Cylone Montha: Vizag gears up to handle the storm
content: Although cyclone Montha is unlikely to hit the Visakhapatnam coast like the 2014 cyclone Hudhud, residents have started to stockpile food and essentials, anticipating disruptions

title: ‘Digital arrest’ scams: Supreme Court inclined to entrust all investigations to CBI
content: Supreme Court is considering a CBI-led investigation into rising digital fraud cases, highlighting a pressing need for coordinated action after alarming incidents involving fraudulent arrests

title: Orange alert issued in north Tamil Nadu districts as Cyclone Montha advances
content: In its Nowcast till 1 p.m. on Monday (October 27), the RMC has predicted moderate rains to continue over Chennai and its neighbouring districts, and Villupuram and Ranipet

title: Thuingaleng Muivah’s homecoming: Where a Manipur village rekindles hope for Naga peace process
content: More than 60 years after he walked out to join the Naga movement that called for a separation from India in 1964, NSCN (I-M) general secretary Thuingaleng Muivah returned to Somdal, his birthplace in Manipur’s Ukhrul district for eight days. His homecoming rekindled hope for a settlement of the Naga peace process hanging fire for almost three decades and signalled a move for reconciliation in the ethnically volatile State

title: Stray dogs case: Supreme Court summons Chief Secretaries of States, UTs over non-compliance with order
content: The Supreme Court ordered Chief Secretaries of all States and Union territories, barring West Bengal, Telangana, and the Municipal Corporation of Delhi, to personally appear before it on November 3

title: Cyclone Montha likely to bring heavy rainfall in Kerala; orange alert for three districts
content: An orange alert warning of very heavy rainfall has been issued for three districts – Kozhikode, Kannur, and Kasaragod – on Monday, while the rest of the State, except for Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam, has been put on yellow alert

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Kharge, Rahul, Priyanka among Congress’ 40-star campaigners
content: Senior leaders Ashok Gehlot, Tariq Anwar, Gaurav Gogoi, Mohammad Jawed, and Akhilesh Prasad Singh are also on the list

title: CJI Gavai recommends appointment of Justice Surya Kant as next CJI
content: Justice Surya Kant, the second senior-most Supreme Court Judge after the incumbent CJI Gavai, is set to become the 53rd CJI following Chief Justice Gavai’s retirement on November 24

title: Law student brutally attacked after argument with shop owner in Kanpur, three arrested
content: Three persons, including the shop owner, have been arrested for the attack search is underway for a fourth accused, they said

title: Eminent plastic surgeon K. Mathangi Ramakrishnan no more
content: She established the plastic surgery department and burns unit at Government Kilpauk Medical College, Chennai — one of the foremost government centres in India dedicated to comprehensive burn care and rehabilitation

title: GCDA questions ₹70-crore stadium upgrade claim ahead of Argentina football match in Kerala
content: Greater Cochin Development Authority chairman says three-member monitoring committee will assess scope of work and determine actual costs involved

title: Cyclone Montha: 269 rehabilitation centres open along the Kakinada coast
content: As many as 59 rehabilitation centres have been opened along the Uppada coast, where fisherfolk are vulnerable to cyclones and coastal erosion

title: Delhi riots case hearing highlights: SC defers to October 31 hearing on bail pleas of Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam and others
content: Delhi High Court on September 2 denied bail to nine people, including Khalid and Imam, saying “conspiratorial” violence under the garb of demonstrations or protests by citizens could not be allowed

title: Kerala ASHA workers urge Mohanlal, Mammooty and Kamal Haasan to boycott LDF’s ‘extreme poverty-free’ declaration event
content: In an open letter to the actors, ASHAs say their lives, trials and tribulations belie LDF government’s claim that Kerala has eradicated extreme poverty. They allege the government has turned a blind eye to their protests

title: Cyclone Montha: Learning from the past, Andhra Government puts special focus on Srikakulam, Vizianagaram districts
content: Vizianagaram Collector S. Ramsundar Reddy and Superintendent of Police A.R. Damodar visited sea coast areas of Bhogapuram and Pusapatirega mandals of the districts

title: 1 killed, 18 injured as tourist bus overturns on MC Road in Kerala’s Kottayam
content: The bus, travelling from Thiruvananthapuram to Kannur, overturned while negotiating a curve around 2 am. 49 people were onboard at the time

title: Jaishankar, Rubio discuss India-U.S. ties, global issues on ASEAN sidelines
content: The meeting took place on the sidelines of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) summit

title: Deep depression over the Bay intensifies into cyclonic storm Montha
content: In its 3 a.m. bulletin, the IMD said the storm is likely to continue to move west-northwestwards over southwest and westcentral Bay of Bengal during the next 12 hours and intensify into a Severe Cyclonic Storm by October 28

title: Cyclonic storm ‘Montha’: Guntur Commissioner orders removal of encroachments and strengthening of flood preparedness
content: In view of the heavy rains and strong winds forecast on account of impending  Montha cyclone, the Commissioner instructed officials to dismantle weak hoardings and temporary structures

title: BM reviews works in Adyar estuary
content: Besides the widening and desilting of Adyar estuary, the CM instructed officials to undertake the widening and desilting works in Cooum, Muttukadu and Ennore estuaries

title: Cyclone Montha LIVE updates: Deep depression over the Bay intensifies into cyclonic storm
content: The IMD has issued red and orange alerts for 23 of the 26 districts in Andhra Pradesh for Monday (October 27) in view of the cyclonic storm ‘Montha’

title: NC was ‘betrayed by supporters’, Abdullahs say, after losing one Rajya Sabha seat from J&K
content: NC vice president and J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said the NC had been betrayed by those people “who attended our meetings and ate with us”

title: Over 22,500 hectares of land taken up for mangrove restoration under MISHTI scheme, 85% of area in Gujarat
content: While 19,220 hectares of land under MISTHI scheme has been taken up in Gujarat, only 10 hectares of mangrove plantation has been taken up in West Bengal which accounts for about 42% of mangrove cover in country

title: President Murmu inaugurates Yashoda Medicity in Indirapuram
content: Other dignitaries included Union Minister of Defence Rajnath Singh, Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh Yogi Adityanath and Union Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare Anupriya Patel, among others

title: Jaishankar holds talks with Malaysian PM, regional counterparts on sidelines of ASEAN summit
content: Mr. Jaishankar discussed the global and regional scenario with Singapore Counterpart Vivian Balakrishnan and deliberated on strengthening bilateral cooperation.

title: Being Bihari matter of pride for people of State now: Nitish
content: Hitting out at the INDIA bloc, without taking names of the Opposition leaders, the CM said that before 2005 (when the RJD was in power), there was complete anarchy in the State

title: Prepare for Janjatiya Gaurav Diwas, Centre urges States
content: In a letter, the government has asked States and UTs to ‘actively participate’ in “inauguration or benefit disbursal targeting tribal populations, launch of tribal-focused schemes, capacity building” and highlighting government schemes such as PM-JANMAN

title: Chief Justice BR Gavai Recommends Justice Surya Kant As His Successor
content: Chief Justice of India Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai has recommended to the Centre the name of Justice Surya Kant as the next CJI.

title: TCS Denies UK Media Report On Losing $1 Billion Marks & Spencer Contract
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has denied a UK media report claiming that British retailer Marks & Spencer (M&S) ended a $1 billion contract with the Indian IT giant after cyberattack-related failures.

title: Madras High Court To Hear 7 Petitions In Karur Stampede Case, Including Bail Pleas
content: The Madras High Court will today hear seven petitions related to the Karur stampede tragedy that claimed 41 lives - including several women and children - exactly a month ago during a rally organised by the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK).

title: Another Hit Job Falls Flat: Washington Post's Credibility Crisis in India
content: Once celebrated as a global symbol of fearless journalism, the Washington Post today faces serious questions about its credibility in India.

title: China's C919 Jet Faces Turbulent Skies Amid Trade Tensions With US
content: China's ambition to challenge Boeing and Airbus with its own homegrown passenger jet is running into turbulence, with deliveries of finished aircraft likely to fall far short of its target announced for this year.

title: Actor Darshan, Pavitra Gowda Accused Of Delaying Renukaswamy Murder Trial
content: The case pertains to the murder of Renukaswamy, a fan who was allegedly abducted, assaulted, and killed in June 2024. Actor Darshan, Pavitra Gowda, and several others are facing serious charges in connection with the crime.

title: Explained: How Cyclone 'Montha' Was Named, What It Means
content: The weather department has warned that low pressure area has formed over the Bay of Bengal, and the depression is likely to gain strength over the next few days.

title: New Twist In Satara Doctor Suicide Case: Woman's False Postmortem Report Claim
content: The doctor in Maharashtra who died by suicide has signed a fake postmortem report, a woman from Satara has alleged.

title: China Minister Warns Of 'Multipolar World' Ahead Of Trump-Xi Talks
content: Global markets are watching closely to see if Thursday's planned meeting between the two presidents can halt a trade war sparked by the sweeping tariffs Trump announced after returning to office this year.

title: 17-Year-Old Arrested For Burning Teen Friend Following An Argument In Thane
content: A 17-year-old girl suffered critical burn injuries after a juvenile allegedly set her ablaze at her home in Maharashtra's Thane city following a quarrel, police said on Monday.

title: Lenskart Sets IPO Price Band At Rs 382-402, Subscription Opens October 31
content: Eyewear retailer Lenskart Solutions on Monday fixed a price band of Rs 382-402 per share for its upcoming initial public offering (IPO), aiming a valuation of over Rs 69,700 crore.

title: Cyclone Montha: Odisha Starts Evacuation Of People From Vulnerable Areas
content: The Odisha government has started evacuating people from vulnerable places and deployed 128 disaster response teams in eight southern districts of the state as the deep depression in the Bay of Bengal on Monday intensified into a cyclonic storm named

title: How New York's High Cost Of Living Is Helping Zohran Mamdani's Mayoral Bid
content: Astronomical rents and housing scarcity are pervasive problems in America's most populous city of 8.5 million people where one in four people cannot afford life's essentials.

title: Robot Dogs, AI Drone Swarms: How China Could Use DeepSeek For An Era Of War
content: China's state-owned defense giant Norinco in February unveiled a military vehicle capable of autonomously conducting combat-support operations at 50 km/hour. It was powered by DeepSeek, the company whose AI model is the pride of China's tech sector.

title: Video: Girl, 7, Hospitalised After Stray Dogs Attack Her In Telangana
content: A seven-year-old girl was seriously injured in Telangana's Hanamkonda after a pack of stray dogs attacked her on a road. The child, Sreeja, has been hospitalised after the horrifying experience.

title: Failing To Repay Rs 2,000, Karnataka Man Attacks Friend With Sickle. He Dies
content: The victim, Manjunath Gowdar, had reportedly borrowed Rs 2,000 from his friend Dayanand Gundloor last week, promising to repay it within seven days.

title: Delhi's Air Quality Remains "Very Poor", Light Rain Expected Today
content: Delhi's air quality remained in the very poor category on Monday even as the weather department forecast a partly cloudy with chances of very light rain towards the evening.

title: 2 Foreign Climbers Die In Nepal After Expeditions To Ama Dablam Mountain
content: Two mountaineers, one French and one South Korean, have died in Nepal after separate expeditions to the Ama Dablam mountain in the Himalayas, hiking officials said on Monday.

title: Tamil Nadu’s power demand remained flat in the first half of 2025-26
content: Its peak power demand has also been lower at 19,878 MW, when compared to the levels reached in the same period last year

title: Prashant Kishor’s home turf awaits verdict on Jan Suraaj promises
content: JSP leader Prashant Kishor last visited his ancestral village Konar in 2017, when his mother passed away; people here are hopeful that the leader can bring change if his candidates win the election

title: College in Vellore holds Endowment lecture
content: According to a press release, the lecture was organised in memory of Chandrabai Singhvi of the college.

title: Andhra Pradesh braces for ‘Montha’ impact as IMD issues red alert for seven districts
content: The IMD has warned that the sea condition may be ‘very rough’ along and off the Andhra Pradesh and Yanam coasts on October 27

title: Webinar on stroke prevention to be held on October 28
content: Participants will also gain insights into available treatment options and lifestyle practices that promote better brain health

title: Pune land deal controversy: Jain monk warns to cancel deal before November 1
content: The Jain community across Maharashtra will launch a one-day silent protest across the State on October 27, a religious hearing on October 28, and observe a one-day fast on October 29

title: U.P. airports see sharp rise in passenger traffic: data
content: Passenger traffic went up from 5.24 million to 6.0 million in April–August 2025 compared to the same period in 2024, govt. data shows

title: Cyclone Montha: IMD forecasts widespread rainfall in Karnataka till October 30
content: For Bengaluru city and the neighbourhood the forecast for the next 36 hours is generally cloudy skies with light to moderate rain

title: Plantation Corporation of Kerala launches  project to identify sustainable cashew farming model
content: The project tests three distinct farming models to determine the most productive and profitable approach for small and marginal farmers across south India

title: Buffalo breeding to get a boost, courtesy new yolk-free technology
content: A ready-to-use, egg yolk-free solution – CRYODIL – can preserve buffalo semen for up to 18 months; this is said to be the first time such a product has been developed and tested in India

title: Satellite for armed forces to be launched next week
content: Also known as GSAT-7R, it is a ‘multi-band communication satellite that will provide services over a wide oceanic region including the Indian landmass’, ISRO said

title: Vypeen–Fort Kochi underwater tunnel project: Govt. to hold stakeholder meet in November
content: The government is hard-pressed to raise about ₹2,500 crore to fund the approximately 3-km-long underwater tunnel

title: D.K. Shivakumar hints at ‘expanding’ IT companies to ease load on ORR
content: The move could reduce travel time for employees, noting that over 10 lakh tech professionals currently work for companies located along the ORR, says Shivakumar

title: Vijay’s TVK may revise campaign strategy as it resumes activities after a nearly month-long break
content: Sources say they expect party activities to gain momentum after their founder’s meeting with the families of the Karur stampede victims in Mamallapuram on October 27

title: CBI takes over the investigation in the Karur stampede case
content: A special CBI team has been pressed into action to gather evidence, according to agency sources. The CBI re-registered the case on the directions of the Supreme Court on October 13

title: Homebuyers’ body FPCE wants changes in RERA law, pitches for rules to verify promoters’ track record
content: Forum For People's Collective Efforts president Abhay Upadhyay has written to Union Minister of Housing and Urban Affairs Manohar Lal, seeking more teeth to regulators established under the law for protecting the interests of consumers

title: Bengaluru engineer finds mention in PM Modi’s ‘Mann ki baat’ for lake rejuvenation
content: Sharma, who moved to Bengaluru from Raipur in 2001 to pursue engineering, says he fell in love with the city’s tree-lined streets

title: Japan seeks Indian workers amid ageing population, but people-to-people ties lag
content: Officials in the Cabinet Secretariat and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs point to the “perfect complementarity” between the two countries.

title: CPI(ML) manifesto promises land justice, 65% reservation for disadvantaged in Bihar
content: CPI(ML) promised government procurement of all crops and guarantee of fair prices, loan waiver for farmers and rural labourers, free electricity for agriculture, guarantee of rights and ban on eviction of sharecroppers, and restoration of Agricultural Produce Market Committee Act.

title: US town police seek info on 'Diwali litterer'
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus small-sample superstars
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this week's new edition of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings, we've identified a player on each team who has excelled way beyond expectations thus far .

title: Where LSU ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the u.s. has a combined record of 298-150 in the FBS . there are eight power 4 schools looking for head coaches .

title: 🚘 Eagles' revenge on Giants leads NFL trolls
content: the Philadelphia Eagles defeated the New York Giants 38-20 at home . the Eagles signal-caller had 179 passing yards and four touchdowns . trolls poke fun at the "Fly Eagles Fly" chant .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 9: Vandy's in the field!
content: Vanderbilt Commodores is on the brink of making its first appearance in any CFP ranking during the playoff era . if the playoff were today, they would already be in the top 12 when the first ranking is released Nov. 4 . there's a chance to make their debut in the coveted top 12 .

title: Aussies beat U.S., win LPGA International Crown
content: minjee Lee and Hannah Green take both of their singles matches to win the LPGA's international crown . the foursomes match between Australians Stephanie Kyriacou and Grace Kim finished in a tie . it's the first win for australia at the match-play tournament, which eluded them in 2023 .

title: A well-done steak for Deion, medium for Dabo: How CFB chefs please everyone's palates
content: in 2019, he was the executive chef of the Seattle Seahawks . he had applied for a culinary position with LSU before where he would be working at Tiger Stadium . in his interview, he cooked for 35 people -- executives, dieticians and other high-ranking officials .

title: Wetzel: As bad as this is, the next betting scandal is coming
content: almost every sports league, team and operation wants in on sports wagering revenue . sponsorships, partnerships. advertising. maybe it's direct payments . sports is awash in gambling cash . more than 30 people were arrested, including big shots .

title: Who said what? Take our college football Week 9 quotes quiz
content: Lane Kiffin starts his interview by quipping with an Oklahoma defender who said Ole Miss wouldn't score on them. (0:40) Week 9 of college football's 2025 regular season was exciting. A number of Top 25 teams won games that were decided by a single score. Just to name a few: No. 4  Alabama  eked out a  29-22 win  over  South Carolina , No. 8  Ole Miss  outlasted No. 13  Oklahoma   34-28 , No. 10  Vanderbilt  beat No. 17  Missouri   17-10 , No. 16  Virginia  beat Bill Belichick's  North Carolina   17-16 , and No. 22  Texas  needed overtime to beat  Mississippi State   45-38 . Saturday produced some great quotes from college football coaches. Can you guess who said what?

title: AP Week 9 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: a relatively stable week in the top 25 -- just three teams lost to unranked opponents . Texas A&M overcame a sluggish start to keep its undefeated season alive . Georgia Tech, Indiana, and Ohio State are now the only other unbeatens remaining .

title: How the matchups line up for all 46 postseason games
content: all four of those teams are in the mix for the college football Playoff . the five highest-ranked conference champions, plus the next seven highest-rated teams, will make the field . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five most-ranked conferences champions will be awarded first-round byes .
